line.en: 'Asaaa. Do you think you can wait over there?'
'Okaaay!'
'Okay, I'm ready. One, two...'
'Whoa!'
THUMP!
I hung the white sheets over the clothes line.
A few tugs and they were all set.
'Working hard as always, eh?'
'? Is that you, Ageha?'
'Hello, Ageha.'
'Hi.'
'Yo.'
'What did you come here for?'
'Man, if I stay home I gotta work in the shop. So\nI ran away here.'
'Are you okay? Your grandma's going to get angry\nagain.'
'It's fine. I said I was going to help out here.'
'I dunno what it is exactly, but when everyone is\nat school and I'm at home, time goes by so\nslowly.'
'I've been able to catch up on my work, so I\nguess that's good.'
One day in September.
Summer vacation is over and the second semester\nhas begun.
But we didn't go to school.
After we broke into the gym storeroom to take\nback the glider, the entire Soaring Club was\nsuspended.
'It's like we became the bad kids. My heart is\npounding...'
'...Why was I suspended too? I'm not even a club\nmember.'
Excluding Yoru, everyone not in the club who\nhelped out did not get suspended.
Honestly, I felt it was a little anticlimactic.
I was really prepared for a stricter punishment.
Despite the results, it felt like our summer\nvacation was extended, and we spent the\nsuspension time relaxing.
'Have you heard from Kotori?'
'She called yesterday. She seems to be doing\nfine.'
'Ah, well then it seems like she's got quite the\nnice home life after all.'
'That's right. It seems like she's getting on by\nherself these days.'
'Hey, let me help out with this.'
'Me too!'
'...I thought I was finished, but I guess I'll go\nwith you since it's hot here.'
'Sure, no problem. I just hung out the sheets, so\nhold on a minute.'
'Got it.'
The white sheets shone against the pure blue sky.
That day...
We flew through the Morning Glory.
Looking at the clear sky, I would have never\nthought it could really have happened.
A passage of clouds across the sky.
We flew through that miracle-like place in the\nsky.
Soon the passage of clouds melted away to the\nrays of the rising sun.
After watching it to the very end, we returned to\nthe runway.
'Welcome back, Kotori! Aoi!'
'Hey you two, welcome back.'
'Welcome back you guys!'
A crowd of people had been waiting on the runway\nfor our return.
'That was great! I was so touched.'
'Me too! That was so amazing!!'
'Yuka was so emotional that she started crying!'
'It was so beautiful...'
Everyone gathered around the cockpit.
I got out first and pushed over Kotori's\nwheelchair, which someone had prepared for us.
While I was getting the wheelchair ready, Ageha\nunbuckled Kotori and got her out.
'Well done.'
'Thanks.'
After realizing how ordinary they were acting,\nthey both laughed.
'We did it!'
'Yay!!'
They high fived.
'Aoi... That was amazing.'
'Hey, Hotaru. You came too, huh?'
'Wow, that sure was amazing. I got goose bumps.'
'Thanks.'
'Next time, let us take it for a flight.'
'Yeah, I wanna fly too.'
'Anytime.'
'Thanks for showing us, Aoi.'
'Akari.'
'Heh, I sure was right by going against the\nteachers' wishes and letting you guys do this.'
'I'm glad we could prove ourselves.'
Everyone came by wanting to say something.
I saw An-chan at the edge of the crowd.
'An-chan!'
Waving my hand at him, he sheepishly entered our\ncrowd.
'An-chan, did you see it?'
'Yeah, of course. It was pretty great, Aoi.'
After being complimented, I could feel myself\nbegin to blush.
'Thanks.'
'Thanks?'
'For all of this.'
Saying that, he started to pat me on the head.
'Hey, I'm not a kid.'
'Haha, sorry, sorry. Bad habit.'
He did it again.
'Hey, stop it!'
Lots of people I had never seen before kept\ncoming up and saying how amazing and wonderful it\nwas.
Kotori and I felt overjoyed to be able to share\nthis moment with so many people.
After a while, when the crowd's energy had\nsubsided,
'Kotori.'
Her father and Hibari walked over to her.
'...I'm sorry.'
'I'm sorry I thought about your dream to fly as\nsimple child's play.'
Kotori's father gave her a deep, apologetic bow.
'Hibari and I both watched you fly. ... The sky\nwas incredibly beautiful.'
There was a sparkle of excitement in his eyes.
He seemed to be just as excited as everyone else\nin the crowd.
'I...I made you lie to me again.'
'No. You were just thinking of me when you said\nthat.'
Her father shook his head.
'I was scared. I was scared of seeing you hurt\nagain.'
'But that's not because I was concerned about\nyou.'
'I should have been encouraging you, but instead\nI was trying to lock you away in a box...'
'I'm sorry.'
Kotori stared at her father's bowed head.
'...I'm sorry too. I'm sorry I kept such a big\nthing from you.'
'Even though I knew how much you all were\nworrying about me.'
'...It's all right. I'm the reason that you did\nthat.'
'You are already able to fly by yourself. I guess\nwithout having seen it with my own eyes...'
As her father spoke, tears began to well in\nKotori's eyes.
But instead of crying, she began to smile.
'Let's go home, dad.'
'Well, mom's worrying, isn't she? I'd like to\nshow her that I'm fine.'
'Are you sure...?'
'Well, just for summer vacation...'
'Oh, okay. Yeah, that'd make her very happy. I'll\ngo get the car.'
He sprinted off towards the car.
He was so happy that he nearly tumbled over a\nrock as he ran.
'I'm sorry for making you worry too, Hibari.'
'No, it's not a big deal as long as you're fine.'
'So what did you think? You did watch... right?'
'Yeah, it was pretty great. It seemed completely\nnatural for you.'
'Hehehe!'
'...It was a little scary, though.'
'You get used to it. Oh yeah! I'll let you ride\nin the back next time!'
'Uh... sure...'
Kotori's big grin seemed to draw a smile out of\nHibari.
'I'll talk to dad about it.'
As Hibari said that, Kotori began looking around\nfor someone.
'What's wrong?'
'Uh... Ah! There she is!'
Kotori sped her wheelchair over to the person she\nwas looking for.
'Amane!'
'Huh? Oh, hey Kotori.'
'Did you see it?'
'Yeah, I did. You were a bit high to see too\nmuch, but I did see it.'
'We flew! We flew through the Morning Glory!'
'Yeah.'
'It was so beautiful. I wish you could have seen\nit too.'
'Haha, I'm good. I shudder at the thought of\nbeing up that high.'
'What! No way. Isn't it your dream to fly?'
'It's not mine. It's Isuka's.'
'Plus, it came true. You all helped make it come\ntrue.'
'You flew the glider that was supposed to take\nIsuka up to those clouds.'
Kotori gave me a timid look.
'Her eyes seemed to be asking what was going on.
I answered with a nod and a smile. Kotori grinned\nherself.
'Well then, I guess it all worked out then!'
'Yeah. Thanks, you guys.'
As Amane cracked a smile, Kotori broke into full\nlaughter.
'Hey, Aoi.'
'Yeah?'
'I'm going to go back to Tokyo for a little bit.'
'That's a good idea.'
'Let your parents spoil you for a while.'
'I will.'
'Don't fool around on me just because you're\nlonely.'
'Like I'd do that.'
'Hm? Dad? What's wrong?'
'...In the blink of an eye, you've made a home of\nyour own.'
'Yeah. Everyone here in Kazegaura seems really\nnice. A whole lot of good people.'
'Yeah...'
'We probably should have been stronger about\nthis...'
'In trying to be a parent that protected her...'
'I kept trying to keep her like a bird in a small\ncage. Her wings were far too big for it, though.'
'That's right...'
'I don't want to keep this suffering going on\nforever. We need to move on.'
'Yeah...'
'Dad! Hibari! Let's go home!!'
'Okay, let's go.'
'Alright.'
With that, Kotori got into the car and the family\ndrove off.
...However.
Since our suspension was issued on the last day\nof summer vacation, she stayed at home throughout\nit.
The days passed...
'Kotori!! Wake up! Breakfast is already ready!!'
'Heeyyyy! Kotori!!!'
'*Yawn* ...Good morning...What time is it?'
'Breakfast's ready. C'mon. Get changed and come\neat.'
'Oh, okay.'
'Breakfast time!'
Fully awake, Kotori began to shove her breakfast\ndown her throat.
'Hey, Hat.'
'Quack quack!'
Hat went over to Kotori and started eating\nsomething.
'I know you don't like vegetables, but don't feed\nthem to Hat.'
'I...I'm in a hurry!'
'How did you sleep in late? Didn't you set your\nalarm?'
'Well... It's been so long since I went to school\nthat I got a little excited. I couldn't sleep at\nall last night.'
Apparently by the time she was able to get to\nsleep, she went ahead and slept right through the\nalarm.
Today our suspension was finally over.
Our extra long summer vacation was now over, and\nour second semester was starting late.
'Good morning, Kotori.'
'Hey Kotori, good morning.'
'Good morning, you two. You're looking a lot\nalike as always.'
'Did you sleep in late? That's not like you.'
'My internal clock is all messed up. Getting\nsuspended and failing classes is one thing, but\nbeing late is not an option.'
'You've got a bit of bed head.'
I pointed this out to her as she was shoveling\nfood into her mouth.
'Ngh'
With bowl and chopsticks still in hand, she\nleaned her head towards me.
'Ugh, you're hopeless.'
Grabbing a brush from the bathroom, I started to\nfix Kotori's hair.
'Huh, you've really got nice hair.'
'Haha, yes I do! I've got some amazingly silky\nsmooth...'
'...OW! Hey, don't pull it.'
'Ah, sorry.'
'Ugh... Be careful. You wouldn't like it if I did\nit to you. My hair's going to be all split ends.'
'That would be terrible.'
'...Ugh, look at those two all touchy-feely as\never. Gets me worked up first thing in the\nmorning.'
'Really? I think it's great. I'm a little\njealous, myself...'
'Ah, that was good.'
'I'll clean up, while you go get ready. C'mon,\nthere's no time.'
'Roger!'
I got behind Kotori's wheelchair as we exited the\nbuilding.
'Let's go! Hold on tight!'
'Let's fly!!!'
'Waa! Hold up, hold up! Aoi! Kotori!'
'...Just as crazy as always. Those two are way\ntoo energetic.'
Going back to school for the first time in what\nfelt like ages, we were greeted as if we were\nheroes.
'Hey, it's the Soaring Club!'
'Kotori and everybody are back!'
'Wha? What? What?'
'I saw the pictures! It was so beautiful!'
'You should have invited us too!!'
The entire class began to gather around us.
Suddenly a huge crowd had formed as students from\nother classes made their way in as well.
'Morning, you two.'
'Ageha, what's going on?'
'Seems like we became a hot topic while we were\nout on suspension.'
'It seems that when all those people came to\nwatch, a few from the school newspaper came as\nwell.'
'Turns out us going against Tobioka and getting\nsuspended was something new and exciting.'
Students rarely get suspended from our school.
It's not really a school where the 'bad kids' go.\nMost students have fun and trouble-free years.
However, Tobioka's hatred is well known, and us\ngetting suspended was talked about like a heroic\nstory.
'...I guess our time has finally come.'
'Don't get too cocky. Being suspended isn't\nsomething to be proud of.'
'I know, I know. I'm not entirely serious.'
'By the way, thanks to all this uproar, we're\ngetting tons of new membership applicants.'
'What!'
Kotori's eyes sparkled.
'What should we do? Should we let them join?'
'That's fine. But if they aren't passionate,\nthey're out!'
'Haha. Which means?'
'The one qualification is having a love for the\nsky! Without that, sorry, but I cannot permit you\ninto the club.'
'You're the only one who feels that way.'
'That's right. Don't lump us in with that. It's\nembarrassing.'
'What!! What do you guys mean you 'don't love the\nsky!?''
Let's put aside Kotori's silly talk for a second.
The Soaring Club is in a strange position right\nnow.
It goes without saying that Tobioka has been\nworking to keep the Soaring Club abolished.
It was originally supposed to have gone smoothly.
However the situation has changed.
Morning Glory became a local news story in\nKazegaura.
It was quite different from the one twenty seven\nyears ago, when the Internet and digital cameras\nweren't widespread.
Even a number of videos taken by the crowd ended\nup on the TV news.
So then this strange cloud was flown through by\nsome students in a homemade glider. What about\nthat?

While we were suspended, the local media
contacted the school about doing coverage. This
led to the principal as well as the directors
learning a lot of the details about what we did.

Especially the chairman of the board (that is,
Asa and Yoru's grandfather) seemed to be
appreciative of all the praise the school was
getting,
and as a result the abolishment of the club was\npostponed.
A lot of ideas came up, such as inviting in\nspecialists from outside the club as well as\ngetting more help.
The school itself is apparently going to be\nexpanding into aerospace engineering studies as\nwell, and that verylikely played a part.
It wasn't just the teachers.
The students who came to watch that day started\nup a petition to keep the club from being\nabolished.
In the petition, Akari had written about all that\nwe had done throughout the year and everything\nthat had led up to that flight.
On the one hand, I couldn't believe she had\nwritten that report, but on the other, it felt\ngreat to have her as an ally.
Because of this, we found ourselves placed into a\nstrange position. However...
'I think new members would be fine. Just as long\nas they are really interested.'
'Yeah. From now on, we don't have to work as\ncrazily as we used to.'
'Wouldn't a laid back Soaring Club be just as\ngood?'
That is, of course, if the club can still exist.
After school that day, as we were chatting while\ngoing down the hall to leave, we saw a familiar\nface in front of the elevator.
'Ah, Amane!'
'Oh? It's you guys.'
'Hi.'
Amane and Akari were chatting.
'What are you doing, Amane?'
'No, no, Kotori. You need to call me\nMochizuki-sensei.'
'The lecture on the new wind turbine project\nstarted today.'
'Oh yeah, that.'
'Are you taking the class, Akari?'
'Yeah.'
Only a limited number of students could get in.\nIt was very competitive, but it wasn't surprising\nthat Akari got in.
'Hm. Amane's become pretty bossy too.'
'You're one to talk...'
'I heard about the petition, Akari. Thanks for\nall of your help.'
'You don't have to thank me. I was just doing\nwhat I thought was right.'
'The end of a club that is that productive would\nbe nothing other than a loss for Keifuu.'
Kotori seemed proud of what Akari was saying.
She had received a lot of compliments today and\nwas starting to get cocky.
'Well then, Amane, you should keep on being the\nadvisor. And we can fly together sometime!'
'Haha, sorry, but I'm going to have to pass.'
Amane spoke bluntly and laughed. Kotori frowned.
'Huh? Why...?'
'I've had my fill of flying.'
'Plus, since I'm an adult, I'll have to be the\none who is responsible.'
Amane was the one who took responsibility for\nKotori's accident.
Basically, the Soaring Club was losing its\nrepresentative.
It was unfortunate, but probably for the best.
This would take away all of her responsibility\nfor the glider.
'Aw... That's no good.'
'If you guys keep flying, I'll be sure to come\nwatch once in a while.'
'Doing stuff with you guys is pretty fun.'
Amane's honesty shocked us.
Akari actually seemed a bit jealous of us.
'See you guys later.'
'Goodbye, Kotori.'
'Take care, Mochizuki-sensei.'
'Goodbye.'
'We're back!'
We headed directly back to the dorm after school.
'Quack quack.'
'Hey, Hat. I'm going to go get you your snack.'
'Quaaaaack.'
Kotori headed off to the dining hall to get Hat's\nfood.
'Seems like we're the first ones back.'

Even though we were on suspension for a while,
the students in my dorm tend take the long way
home or have clubs. Usually no one is around at
this time.
Returning to my room, I put down my bag and\nstarted changing out of my school uniform.
'It sure is hot for September. I guess I'll\nchange my t-shirt.'
All of a sudden Kotori was peeking through my\nslightly open door.
'Hey... When did you become a Peeping Tom?'
'Hmph. There's nothing wrong with a little\nlooking.'
If everyone allowed this, Japan would become a\npervert's paradise.
'It sure is boring without the club.'
Saying this, Kotori begins poking through my\nbookshelf.
'That's because we spent pretty much every free\nminute in the club this year.'
I didn't realize how busy it kept us until it was\nsuddenly gone.
Busy, sure. But it was so very fulfilling.
As we talked, I decided to just change my\nt-shirt.
'...What?'
Kotori was looking at my naked upper body.
'Nothing really. But have you gotten more\nmuscly?'
'Have I?'
I wasn't sure how to respond but I couldn't help\nbut be a little happy.
'Actually, while I've been suspended from school\nI started cycling again.'
'Really?'
'That day I chased after you I really overdid it,\nthough. My knee started hurting again...'
Kotori began to look extremely worried.
'I went to the hospital and got it checked out.\nThey said it was nothing to worry over.'
'They said as long as I didn't overdo it, it'd be\nalright for me to ride.'
It'd be fine as long as I didn't race, they said.
'So since I haven't been getting much exercise, I\nstarted going out on little excursions.'
'Aha.'
'There's really nothing else to do.'
The school is still deciding what to do about the\nSoaring Club, and the winch is still being\nrepaired. All we can do is wait.
Letting out a sigh that said nothing about her\nfeelings, Kotori stared at the bicycle in the\ncorner of my room.
'How was home?'
'Okay, I guess.'
I still hadn't heard the details of her time\nhome.
Kotori only came back late last night. This was\nthe first time we were together since then.
'How's your mother doing?'
'She's perfectly fine now. I was really surprised\nwhen I heard she collapsed, although I guess she\ndoes tend to overreact.'
'In less than an hour after she saw me she was\nback up on her feet and cooking.'
'She has no consideration for anyone else.'
This is the mother who Kotori had decided to quit\nschool and go home for.
'Well, that's just because she worries about you,\nright?'
'Did you talk to her about the glider...?'
'I told her everything. And after that, she\ncollapsed again.'
'Sheesh...'
'But Hibari and my dad helped me out. Now she's\nkind of okay with it... Well, maybe not\nentirely.'
'... It'll probably take some more time, I\nthink.'
Considering how she sounds, I doubt she'll be so\neasily persuaded.
The only thing to do is to keep being persistent.
'And they're going to let you stay here?'
'Yup! Actually, my father said that it would\nprobably be best for me to stay!'
'Wow.'
Hard to believe he'd say that after how much he\nwanted to take her back home.
'Having seen something so miraculous as the\nMorning Glory definitely showed him the truth.'
She was completely serious.
I guess that could be the case. That view did\nbring out an excitement in some people from deep\ndown within.
But in this situation, witnessing your daughter\nreach a goal would be the bigger thing... I\nthink.
'So in exchange for me staying, I have to go home\nevery so often, and my family are going to come\nhere and see me once in a while, too.'
'Really? Well that's good. Especially since\nyou're not that far of a drive away.'
'Yeah.'
'And... My father was saying nice things about\nyou.'
'About me?'
She nodded.
'Eh...that's kind of embarrassing.'
'He was saying what a 'promising young fellow'\nyou were.'
'My mother also said she wants to meet you. Will\nyou come with me next time?'
'Oh? Yeah, sure.'
'Hehe, I'm sure she'll love you. You're tall and\nsooo good looking.'
I'm going to meet her mother...
Even though I know it's just a simple meeting, it\nstill makes me nervous.
'Recently was the first time I saw you riding\nyour bicycle...'
'...You looked so amazing! I had goose bumps. You\nreally are my prince.'
'I fell in love with you all over again...\n*blush*'
She turned red and started to look nervous.
'In fact... You looked so amazing that you\nactually appeared in one of my dreams recently.'
'Really? What kind of dream?'
'Hmm? That's a secret.'
'What? You won't tell me?'
'Nope! Company secret!'
What company.
Kotori came closer and gazed at me.
'...I still can't believe that I have such an\namazingly good looking boyfriend.'
'I still wonder if it's not some kind of\nmistake.'
'What do you mean 'mistake'? Do you still think I\ndon't care about you?'
'Well, did you dream about me while we were\napart?'
'You didn't! so you don't like me after all--!!'
'I did! Of course I did!'
'Well then why did it take you so long to answer?\nYou really don't love me at all, do you?'
'That's cause...'
Its content is a bit hard to say upfront...
Especially the perverted part.
However Kotori worriedly looked up at me.
'...Did you really see one?'
'Uuu...yes, I did. Serious.'
'What was the dream?''
'Well, it was, uh...'
I kneeled down and looked Kotori in the eyes.
I kissed her.
'...This kind of dream.'
'...Just that?'
'Are you just saying that even though you know\nwhat I mean?'
'Huh? I don't know what you mean at all.'
I brought her body close to mine.
'Kya!'
Kotori hugged me back.
Then I lifted her up.
And then,
'Huh? Kyaaa!'
I placed her down on her bed.
A little startled, and slightly teary in the\neyes, she looked up at me.
Then I got up on the bed myself and hovered over\nher.
'It was this kind of dream.'
'...So it was a spicy dream.'
'It hadn't finished last time...what should we\ndo?'
Kotori looked at me as if saying, "How could you\nask that so casually!
Then at last she looked away with a pouting face\nand said,
'...Please tell me how it went...'
'Ahh fine, I'll show you then.'
'Glaring at me now as if saying, "you big\nbully!". So cute.
Then I gave her an even gentler kiss than normal.
As our lips overlapped, I undid the button on her\nblouse.
One by one the buttons unfasten, and each time\nKotori shivered to it.
'Hfuuu...'
When we finished the kiss, all the buttons had\nbeen undone.
Underneath it, I can see her underwear exposed.
'Auuu...I didn't think we were going to do\nthis...that's why I didn't wear my cute one...'
'Really? I think it's plenty cute.'
I prevented Kotori from hiding herself with her\narms, then caressed her not-too-large breasts\nwith my hands.
'Aaan...haa...haa...'
'You're sweating a little.'
'D...don't say that.'
'I'll wipe it for you.'
I brought my lips to Kotori's neck and kissed her\nall the way down to her chest.
'Hyaaa! D-...don't lick the sweat, it's\ndirty...haa, haa...'
The girl's body is so mysterious.
When a guy sweats this much he, smells pretty\nbad. But a girl doesn't smell at all.
In fact it's the opposite, she starts to smell\nnice.
I thought to myself as I kissed the valley\nbetween her two bosoms.
'Haa, haa...geez, are you really sure you saw\nthis kind of dream?'
'Yeah, I saw it.'
'Uuu...so it was an erotic dream then.'
'And what was your dream Kotori?'
'...That's a secret.'
She averted my gaze and replied with a blush.
Could it be she had a similar dream to mine...? I\nstarted to suspect as much, but I kept quiet\nabout it.
'I'm taking this off.'
'Kyaawaa...!?'
I reached behind Kotori's back and undid her bra.
I undid the hook so quickly that Kotori was a\nlittle startled.
'That's so skilled...'
'...You didn't practice that on someone else did\nyou?'
'No I didn't.'
Only in my head.
I removed the loosened bra, exposing the cute\npair of breasts underneath.
'Oooh...'
'Don't look at them directly...'
'No, I'm looking.'
I pushed aside Kotori's arms which were trying to\nblock herself, and gazed upon the wonderful\nsight.
'Uuuuu... it's embarassing.'

The sun's rays pouring in through the window
illuminated Kotori's breasts and made them look
incredibly beautiful; they were so sacred looking
that I was hesitant to touch them.
The skin was smooth and detailed, the pink nipple\nlooked delicious.
'Kotori's breasts are beautiful, just like I\nthought...'
'...They are? How?'
'Like the color, the shape...?'
And their smallish shape made them a bit\nchildish.
But the quiet Kotori's face looked grown-up to\nme, and their contrast made her all the more\ncute.
...But if I told her honestly what I thought, I'm\nsure she would get angry at me again.
I slowly brought my lips to her breasts and.
'Haan, nnnnn...!?'
The moment I closed my mouth on her nipple, her\nshoulders shuddered.
And like that, I sucked deeply on it, nibbling a\nlittle.
'Amuuu...chuu, chuupu.'
'Haan, nn, nn, aah, aaah...it's being sucked...'
Kotori quickly emitted some sweet noises, and\ntried weakly to resist my teasing.
But I wouldn't let go of her nipple.
'Aan, aan... ah, ah, nn...nfuuuuu...!!'
'Churu...churu, chupa...nguu.'
'I said don't...haa, haa, haa.'
Kotori, now teary eyed, glared at me in\ndispleasure.
While staring back at those eyes, I continued\nrolling my tongue over her pink protuberance.
'Fuu, nn, nnnnnff...ah, aaan, aan, aaah, n, nn,\nnhaaa... nnk, nn, ah, ah, nn, nnn...'
'Aaah, aan, ah, aah... nn, nn, nnn...haa,\nhaa...fuu, fuu...afuuuu.'
Unable to withstand my persistent assault,\nKotori's body convulsed.
'Haa, haa...your nipple is getting harder and\nharder.'
'Noo...don't say that, it's embarassing.'
Kotori lightly beat on my head.
'Ouch ouch...but you're cute when you're\nembarassed.'
'Uuuu...'
'She gives me a look as if to say "Oh, well then.
Even that part of her is stupidly cute.
I flicked my tongue across Kotori's now stiffened\nnipples.
'Nhyaaa!? Nnn, ah, ah, aaaf! Ah, aan, aan, ah,\nkuu, fuuuu...!'
Her breasts were now being rolled in every\ndirection.

'...I thought maybe that you hadn't noticed my\nsign.'
She was talking about the SOS she had sent. The\nplain, nondescript paper airplane.
'I didn't get it at first, but then I remembered\nthe first time we met.'
'Honestly, I wasn't planning on doing that, but\nthen I thought of it and made the airplane to\ngive to Hibari.'
Kotori asking me to help her was basically her\nchoosing flying over her family.
That is not something she could have said.
Instead, she put her feelings into that paper\nairplane and had me go to her.
'I was able to fly through the Morning Glory\nthanks to you realizing that.'
'If it weren't for you, Aoi, I wouldn't be here\nright now...'
'...And I probably wouldn't have been able to\nlook at the sky anymore.'
That's the one thing she said she could do.
'Well, every time I'd look up high into the sky,\nI'd remember that I couldn't fly.'
'So I decided that I just wouldn't look up\nanymore.'
'But I flew. Now I know I can fly.'
'It...It might be harder for me than for other\npeople, but...'
'I took back my future.'
'Yeah.'
At some point, Kotori had begun looking straight\nup at the apex of the sky.
I felt like Kotori was always looking up higher\nthan I was.
Noticing her doing this, I set my eyes at the\nsame spot hers were looking at.
I was thankful for Kotori as well.
'And well... Actually...'
Kotori was suddenly mumbling.
'There's one more thing that I want to talk to\nyou about.'
The timid look on her face caused me to brace\nmyself.
'Did something happen while you were at home?'
Something had happened.
'Well... We found one...'
'Found what?'
'...A hospital that can do the surgery.'
At first I didn't know what she was talking\nabout.
But when I realized a moment later, I could\nbarely believe it.
'By surgery, you mean...'
I looked down at Kotori's legs.
She nodded.
She then stretched out an arm towards me.
I took her hand in my own. It was trembling\nslightly.
'...Are you scared?'
Kotori nodded.
'...If it doesn't work out, that means I'll never\nbe able to recover.'
Losing that 'possibility of recovery' was the\nsame as losing all hope.
It would be better to have that hope, even if it\nwasn't real.
'It's okay. I'll be there with you.'
Nothing will change, even if it's not a success.
But Kotori shook her head.
'...That's impossible.'
'Why?'
'...Because it's in America.'
'Huh?'
'In order to have the operation, I'll have to go\nto America.'
'Oh. I see.'
For a moment, I thought about going with her.
'...I'm scared, but I have to do it.'
Her tone was anxious as she gazed at me with tear\nfilled eyes.
'Because I want to go on a date with you where we\nwalk hand in hand...'
I was shocked to hear this news, shocked to the\npoint of trembling. But I concealed my feelings\nand held Kotori's shaking hand.
However the surgery would not be performed right\naway.
Kotori's situation wasn't urgent, and since it\nwas a famous doctor, there was a waiting list.
In the meantime, Kotori got her passport and\nschool leave sorted out. She went to America two\nmonths later.
The surgery was a success.
The feeling had returned to Kotori's legs.
Knowing the chance of success, it was nothing\nshort of a miracle.
However the real challenge was only just\nbeginning.
After returning home, she began her days of\ngrueling rehabilitation.
Once again she was feeling the pains of not being\nable to do things she could once do.
However, Kotori Habane is not the sort to give up\nthat easily.
After months of rehabilitation, she was able to\nstand herself up on crutches.
During that time, we became seniors, and the new\nfreshmen started at Keifuu.
Then, just around the time when summer was about\nto start...
Today is my first flight in a long time.
When I arrived at the runway, someone was already\nwaiting there.
Standing there on crutches, she looked more like\nan adult than a girl.
After a sudden wind blew her long hair, she\ntucked it behind her ears. She looked completely\nnatural.
But her eyes were just like that of a child.
An impatient look twinkled in her eyes as she\ngazed at the far reaching horizon.
I want to fly right now!
I heard it in my head as real as day.
'Aoi.'
'Hey, you're already here.'
'Yeah, I thought I'd see how the conditions\nwere.'
'Seems pretty good.'
'It does. There's a real nice wind blowing. There\nshould be a good vertical draft, too.'
'This is the best opportunity to fly.'
'Yeah.'
The end of summer is the one time of the year\nwhen vertical drafts are most likely to occur.
A clear day like today really is the best for\nflying.
'You're going to fly today, right?'
'Yeah.'
'I've got to teach those freshmen what flying\nreally is.'
'...Ah, quit it with that sappy talk. It's\nannoying.'
'What!?'
'Well... You know there just aren't many people\nlike you who say that they 'love the sky'.'
'Ugh... Kids these days.'
'...Three years younger than us and you sure can\nfeel the generation gap.'
'We sure are getting old.'
It was a joke, but it had been two years since we\nfirst met.
So many things happened during that time.
Too many things. It's impossible to believe all\nthose things happened in only two years.
'...There's a lot of stuff we need to teach the\nnew kids. The passion and yearning for the sky.'
'Oh yeah, that's right.'
The dream handed down from Amane.
We spent that entire year with one goal on our\nmind. It was a completely irreplaceable year.
One of the dreams had been realized.
However, the sky still went on higher and higher\nwithout end.
'Oh yeah, Amane said she'd come by today to\nwatch.'
'Really?! Alright, we've gotta show her what we\ncan do!'
The grass waved as the wind cut through the\nrunway.
The wind blowing over the lake was one unique to\nKazegaura.
Our wings give us the power to fly.
'Runway is clear!'
'The winch is ready to go.'
'Preparations are all done here.'
'Okay, Kotori, let's go!'
'Alright! Let's take off!'
We're flying.
We spread out our white wings and flew towards\nanywhere underneath the vast blue sky.
